# Appendix: Cluster sizes

## Default Cluster Sizes

For self-managed Materialize, the cluster sizes are configured with the
following default resource allocations:

| Size     | Scale | CPU Limit | Disk Limit  | Memory Limit |
|----------|-------|-----------|-------------|--------------|
| `25cc`   | `1`   | `0.5`     | `7762MiB`   | `3881MiB`    |
| `50cc`   | `1`   | `1`       | `15525MiB`  | `7762MiB`    |
| `100cc`  | `1`   | `2`       | `31050MiB`  | `15525MiB`   |
| `200cc`  | `1`   | `4`       | `62100MiB`  | `31050MiB`   |
| `300cc`  | `1`   | `6`       | `93150MiB`  | `46575MiB`   |
| `400cc`  | `1`   | `8`       | `124201MiB` | `62100MiB`   |
| `600cc`  | `1`   | `12`      | `186301MiB` | `93150MiB`   |
| `800cc`  | `1`   | `16`      | `248402MiB` | `124201MiB`  |
| `1200cc` | `1`   | `24`      | `372603MiB` | `186301MiB`  |
| `1600cc` | `1`   | `31`      | `481280MiB` | `240640MiB`  |
| `3200cc` | `1`   | `62`      | `962560MiB` | `481280MiB`  |
| `6400cc` | `2`   | `62`      | `962560MiB` | `481280MiB`  |

## Custom Cluster Sizes

When installing the Materialize Helm chart, you can override the
[default cluster sizes and resource
allocations](/docs/self-managed/v25.2/sql/appendix-cluster-sizes/).
These cluster sizes are used for both internal clusters, such as the
`system_cluster`, as well as user clusters.

<div class="tip">

**üí° Tip:** In general, you should not have to override the defaults. At
minimum, we recommend that you keep the 25-200cc cluster sizes.

</div>

<div class="highlight">

``` chroma
operator:
  clusters:
    sizes:
      <size>:
        workers: <int>
        scale: 1                  # Generally, should be set to 1.
        cpu_exclusive: <bool>
        cpu_limit: <float>         # e.g., 6
        credits_per_hour: "0.0"    # N/A for self-managed.
        disk_limit: <string>       # e.g., "93150MiB"
        memory_limit: <string>     # e.g., "46575MiB"
        selectors: <map>           # k8s label selectors
        # ex: kubernetes.io/arch: amd64
```

</div>

<table>
<colgroup>
<col style="width: 25%" />
<col style="width: 25%" />
<col style="width: 25%" />
<col style="width: 25%" />
</colgroup>
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Field</th>
<th>Type</th>
<th>Description</th>
<th>Recommendation</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td><strong>workers</strong></td>
<td>int</td>
<td>The number of timely workers in your cluster replica.</td>
<td>Use 1 worker per CPU core, with a minimum of 1 worker.</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td><strong>scale</strong></td>
<td>int</td>
<td>The number of pods (i.e., processes) to use in a cluster replica;
used to scale out replicas horizontally. Each pod will be provisioned
using the settings defined in the size definition.</td>
<td>Generally, this should be set to 1. This should only be greater than
1 when a replica needs to take on limits that are greater than the
maximum limits permitted on a single node.</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td><strong>cpu_exclusive</strong></td>
<td>bool</td>
<td>The flag that determines if the workers should attempt to pin to a
particular CPU core.</td>
<td><p><span id="cpu_exclusive"></span></p>
<p>Set to true <strong>if and only if</strong> the <a
href="#cpu_limit"><code>cpu_limit</code></a> is a whole number and the
CPU management policy in the k8s cluster is set to static.</p></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td><strong>cpu_limit</strong></td>
<td>float</td>
<td><span id="cpu_limit"></span> The k8s limit for CPU for a replica pod
in cores.</td>
<td><p>Prefer whole number values to enable CPU affinity. Kubernetes
only allows CPU Affinity for pods taking a whole number of cores.</p>
<p>If the value is not a whole number, set <a
href="#cpu_exclusive"><code>cpu_exclusive</code></a> to false.</p></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td><strong>memory_limit</strong></td>
<td>float</td>
<td>The k8s limit for memory for a replica pod in bytes.</td>
<td><dl>
<dt>For most workloads, use an approximate <strong>1:8</strong>
CPU-to-memory ratio (1 core</dt>
<dd>
8 GiB). This can vary depending on your workload characteristics.
</dd>
</dl></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td><strong>disk_limit</strong></td>
<td>float</td>
<td>The size of the NVMe persistent volume to provision for a replica
pod in bytes.</td>
<td>When spill-to-disk is enabled, use a <strong>1:2</strong>
memory-to-disk ratio. Materialize spills data to disk when memory is
insufficient, which can impact performance.</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td><strong>credits_per_hour</strong></td>
<td>string</td>
<td>This is a cloud attribute that should be set to ‚Äú0.00‚Äù in
self-managed.</td>
<td>Set to ‚Äú0.00‚Äù for self-managed deployments.</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td><strong>selectors</strong></td>
<td>map</td>
<td>This is a map of selector keys to values that will be used to
schedule pods for this cluster on specific nodes.</td>
<td>It is generally not required to set this.</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>

<div class="note">

**NOTE:** If you have modified the default cluster size configurations,
you can query the
[`mz_cluster_replica_sizes`](/docs/self-managed/v25.2/sql/system-catalog/mz_catalog/#mz_cluster_replica_sizes)
system catalog table for the specific resource allocations.

</div>

</div>
